result.execSummary:
The defendant Anthony M Stefanello was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Court will allow for transfer to the State of Arizona if they are willing to accept him.
Apply 99 days sentence credit, if revoked.

miscConds.notes: Restitution ($459) is payable to Victim M.H. listed in the criminal complaint and to be paid as a Condition of Probation and is to be paid within the first six months of probation (BEFORE costs/fines).

Court costs ($268) and DNA surcharge ($250) are to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.
AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.

ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit to random urine screens.
No use or possession of alcohol, illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged and distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (for example, bars, taverns or liquor stores).
No contact with any of the victims listed in the criminal complaint or read in list.
Provide DNA sample if not yet provided.

timeConds.notes:
Non-working hours (Huber) - with Standard Release Conditions. 
Defendant to report to huber facility no later than 06:00 p.m. on 03-04-2015.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant IS eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program. Defendant IS eligible for  Substance Abuse Program. Apply 319 days sentence credit.
06-20-2018 COURT GRANTS SENTENCE CREDIT AMENDED TO 322 DAYS

superMiscConds.notes:
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.
Continue to work towards GED or HSED.
AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.

ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit to random urine screens.
No use or possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No contact with the victim listed in the Criminal Complaint.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
Mental health evaluation and follow through with any treatment.
Any outstanding restitution, court costs/fines/surcharges are to be paid as a Condition of The Sentence.

records.addlTxt:
Request filed by the Dept. of Corrections requesting clarification on credit for time served.

06/19/18 - Court Reviewed - Request Granted - Corrected JOC to be prepared granting 322 days credit.
Letter from Atty Eryn Menden advising the Office of the State Public Defender no longer represents Defendant
Probation revoked, sentence imposed.

Kristi J Gordon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Anthony M Stefanello in court, in custody, with attorney Eryn M Menden. 

State presented their revocation recommendations.
Defense presented their revocation recommendations.
Defendant presented a statement to the court.


Court orders the following:
Total Prison: 6.5 Years.
Initial Confinement: 2.5 Years.
Extended Supervision:  4 Years.
319 Days Credit.

Defendant is eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for Substance Abuse Program.
 
CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:  
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
Defendant to continue to work towards his GED or HSED.
No contact with:  Victim listed in the criminal complaint.
Mental health evaluation and follow through with any treatment.

Any outstanding restitution, costs/fines/surcharges are to be paid as a Condition of the Sentence.

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on February 1, 2018 at 02:00 pm.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on February 1, 2018 at 11:30 am.
